Message: fix: auto reply to OPTIONS requests only when unhandled (#4559)
Description: Prior to this change the internal options middleware always responsed to such requests. This is because the middleware was registered too early and was not being used as a fallback. With this change we register this middleware as the last middleware to ensure that this is only used as a fallback when OPTIONS requests are not handled. Closes #4551
Message Abstract: fix: auto reply to OPTIONS requests only when unhandled (#4559)
Description Abstract: Prior to this change the internal options middleware always responsed to such requests. This is because the middleware was registered too early and was not being used as a fallback. With this change we register this middleware as the last middleware to ensure that this is only used as a fallback when OPTIONS requests are not handled. Closes #4551

Message: chore: get rid of glob dependencies by switching del with rimraf (#4258)
Description: Replacing del gets rid of about 10 extra dependencies, most are related to globbing, like globby, fast-glob and dir-glob. del wraps rimraf in promisify and adds 1. more sophisticated globbing 2. deletion of multiple files at once by passing an array 3. a check to prevent deleting the current working directory and outside Since the code base does not use any of the extra features, we can just wrap rimraf with promisify instead of using del. Co-authored-by: Nitin Kumar snitin315@gmail.com
Message Abstract: chore: get rid of glob dependencies by switching del with rimraf (#4258)
Description Abstract: Replacing del gets rid of about 10 extra dependencies, most are related to globbing, like globby, fast-glob and dir-glob. del wraps rimraf in promisify and adds 1. more sophisticated globbing 2. deletion of multiple files at once by passing an array 3. a check to prevent deleting the current working directory and outside Since the code base does not use any of the extra features, we can just wrap rimraf with promisify instead of using del. Co-authored-by: Nitin Kumar snitin315@gmail.com

Description: Tell the server at what URL to serve devServer.contentBase. If there was a file assets/manifest.json, it would be served at /serve-content-base-at-this-url/manifest.json webpack.config.js javascript module.exports = {   //...   devServer: {     contentBase: path.join(__dirname, 'assets'),     contentBasePublicPath: '/serve-content-base-at-this-url'   } }; Now webpack-dev-server serves static files (contentBase) from root ignoring publicPath Using added option we can serve static files from publicPath This use case is needed in create-react-app, when want to serve all files from publicPath doesn't matter in development or production https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/pull/7259
Description Abstract: Tell the server at what URL to serve devServer.contentBase. If there was a file assets/manifest.json, it would be served at /serve-content-base-at-this-url/manifest.json webpack.config.js javascript module.exports = {   //...   devServer: {     contentBase: path.join(__dirname, 'assets'),     contentBasePublicPath: '/serve-content-base-at-this-url'   } }; Now webpack-dev-server serves static files (contentBase) from root ignoring publicPath Using added option we can serve static files from publicPath This use case is needed in create-react-app, when want to serve all files from publicPath doesn't matter in development or production link

Description: The webpack configuration stats property has the same format as the devServer.stats property, so the same object is frequently reused to define the same stats output. Since webpack v3.8.0, the stats property is validated more strictly by webpack.  webpack-dev-server is mutating this stats object by adding a colors property, which is an object and doesn't match the webpack configuration schema, causing a fatal error. The easy fix is to not mutate the stats object, so webpack isn't breaking with a fatal error.  But we may also consider setting a valid colors property.
Description Abstract: The webpack configuration stats property has the same format as the devServer.stats property, so the same object is frequently reused to define the same stats output. Since webpack v3.8.0, the stats property is validated more strictly by webpack.  webpack-dev-server is mutating this stats object by adding a colors property, which is an object and doesn't match the webpack configuration schema, causing a fatal error. The easy fix is to not mutate the stats object, so webpack isn't breaking with a fatal error.  But we may also consider setting a valid colors property.

Description: webpack-dev-server bundles sockjs-client from source. sockjs-client sources assume a node environment however, and will fail to run if global is not available. By bundling sockjs-client from source, the node environment requirement from sockjs-client will also be required of the app being served and thus it is not possible to have node.global = false in the user app being bundled. This fix uses the built sockjs-client instead of the sources. Fix https://github.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1147
Description Abstract: webpack-dev-server bundles sockjs-client from source. sockjs-client sources assume a node environment however, and will fail to run if global is not available. By bundling sockjs-client from source, the node environment requirement from sockjs-client will also be required of the app being served and thus it is not possible to have node.global = false in the user app being bundled. This fix uses the built sockjs-client instead of the sources. Fix link

Message: allow explicitly setting the protocol from the public option (#1117)
Description: allow explicitly setting the protocol from the public option   add feedback from PR + add example   found one other glitch that auto-reload doesn't work in iframes since it tries to reload the iframe itself (which has src about:blank) and therefore cannot be reloaded properly. I'm now checking for protocol about: and traverse upwards until a reloadable window can be found. Feedback on this fix is welcome!   fix linting issues   provide tests for createDomain helper function   found a bug due to tests: url.parse doesn't properly parse a provided public option since it counts everything before the port colon as the protocol which is just wrong. I replaced it with a protocol regex.   increase timeout for https test which exceeds default 2000ms   move info log to the place where the reload happens   apply feedback   remove docker stuff from examples (minimize example)   use setInterval and clearInterval instead of do while loop when getting root window for reload   increase test timeout for https to 60 seconds
Message Abstract: allow explicitly setting the protocol from the public option (#1117)
Description Abstract: allow explicitly setting the protocol from the public option add feedback from PR + add example found one other glitch that auto-reload doesn't work in iframes since it tries to reload the iframe itself (which has src about:blank) and therefore cannot be reloaded properly. I'm now checking for protocol about: and traverse upwards until a reloadable window can be found. Feedback on this fix is welcome! fix linting issues provide tests for createDomain helper function found a bug due to tests: url.parse doesn't properly parse a provided public option since it counts everything before the port colon as the protocol which is just wrong. I replaced it with a protocol regex. increase timeout for https test which exceeds default 2000ms move info log to the place where the reload happens apply feedback remove docker stuff from examples (minimize example) use setInterval and clearInterval instead of do while loop when getting root window for reload increase test timeout for https to 60 seconds

Message: Always allow requests with IP-address as host in checkHost() (#1007)
Description: Always allow requests with IP-address as host in checkHost()  This patch will allow any requests made using an IP-address to always pass the checkHost-test. IP-addresses are not susceptible to a dns-rebind like attack so it would make sense to not block them to make local-network development possible without needing to disable the host-checks entirely. fixes #931  use 'ip'-module to handle ip-address validation.  As per @shellscape's comment, switch to the ip-module to do validation of ip-address-format.
Message Abstract: Always allow requests with IP-address as host in checkHost() (#1007)
Description Abstract: Always allow requests with IP-address as host in checkHost() This patch will allow any requests made using an IP-address to always pass the checkHost-test. IP-addresses are not susceptible to a dns-rebind like attack so it would make sense to not block them to make local-network development possible without needing to disable the host-checks entirely. fixes #931 use 'ip'-module to handle ip-address validation. As per @shellscape's comment, switch to the ip-module to do validation of ip-address-format.

Message: Update connect-history-api-fallback to enable disableDotRule use (#638)
Description: Currently, webpack-dev-server is requiring connect-history-api-fallback@^1.2.0 which might resolve to 1.2.0 on current installs.  This version doesn't yet allow for the disableDotRule option enabled in https://github.com/bripkens/connect-history-api-fallback/commit/ee8611164c4a06ed87d7b98b16dedb89f60ff3a3. Using the following in the Webpack Dev Server config works when connect-history-api-fallback@1.3.0 is installed: historyApiFallback: {         disableDotRule: true,       },
Message Abstract: Update connect-history-api-fallback to enable disableDotRule use (#638)
Description Abstract: Currently, webpack-dev-server is requiring connect-history-api-fallback@^1.2.0 which might resolve to 1.2.0 on current installs.  This version doesn't yet allow for the disableDotRule option enabled in link. Using the following in the Webpack Dev Server config works when connect-history-api-fallback@1.3.0 is installed: historyApiFallback: {         disableDotRule: true,       },

Message: sanity check that conn exists on connection (#637)

Description: The problem earlier with the fix in #627 was that it broke serving files without extensions (or with disableDotRule). This passed the test because the disableDotRule: true was removed; without this the test will always succeed because without this rule, a request like /other.html will always go directly to the file.
Description Abstract: The problem earlier with the fix in #627 was that it broke serving files without extensions (or with disableDotRule). This passed the test because the disableDotRule: true was removed; without this the test will always succeed because without this rule, a request like /other.html will always go directly to the file.

Message: Use stronger certs to prevent browsers from whining (#572)
Description: These certs use SHA-256 instead of SHA-1, which some browsers (especially Firefox) really dont like. Generated with: openssl genrsa -out ca.key 2048 openssl req -x509 -new -nodes -key ca.key -sha256 -days 1024 -out ca.pem openssl genrsa -out server.key 2048 openssl req -new -key server.key -out server.csr openssl x509 -req -in server.csr -CA ca.pem -CAkey ca.key -CAcreateserial -out server.crt -days 500 -sha256
Message Abstract: Use stronger certs to prevent browsers from whining (#572)
Description Abstract: These certs use SHA-256 instead of SHA-1, which some browsers (especially Firefox) really dont like. Generated with: openssl genrsa -out ca.key 2048 openssl req -x509 -new -nodes -key ca.key -sha256 -days 1024 -out ca.pem openssl genrsa -out server.key 2048 openssl req -new -key server.key -out server.csr openssl x509 -req -in server.csr -CA ca.pem -CAkey ca.key -CAcreateserial -out server.crt -days 500 -sha256

Message: Remove overriding output.path to "/" when using CLI
Description: The assignment was originally to enforce linux style paths, because the prev versions of memory-fs doesn't support windows style paths. But as it supports it now it should be fine to remove this. Ref #337
Message Abstract: Remove overriding output.path to "/" when using CLI
Description Abstract: The assignment was originally to enforce linux style paths, because the prev versions of memory-fs doesn't support windows style paths. But as it supports it now it should be fine to remove this. Ref #337

Description: Before, the client script would retry for a websocket connection every two seconds. This caused massive log spam. Now, it will retry with an exponential timeout, and with a max of 10 retries.
Description Abstract: Before, the client script would retry for a websocket connection every two seconds. This caused massive log spam. Now, it will retry with an exponential timeout, and with a max of 10 retries.

Message: Remove js-beautify and improve ESLint config (#590)
Description: Before, there were two linters doing the same thing: linting and fixing lint errors. Now, there is only one, ESLint. The js-beautify config is merged in the ESLint config as best as I could do. There is almost no documentation about the rules of js-beautify, so this was a bit hard. ESLint was updated to v3, which provides auto-fixing of some rules. I also checked the new ESLint config against the main webpack repo. This caused some extra linting errors (~40), but these were all valid violations.
Message Abstract: Remove js-beautify and improve ESLint config (#590)
Description Abstract: Before, there were two linters doing the same thing: linting and fixing lint errors. Now, there is only one, ESLint. The js-beautify config is merged in the ESLint config as best as I could do. There is almost no documentation about the rules of js-beautify, so this was a bit hard. ESLint was updated to v3, which provides auto-fixing of some rules. I also checked the new ESLint config against the main webpack repo. This caused some extra linting errors (~40), but these were all valid violations.

Message: Add option to bypass proxying requests based on a function call
Description: The primary use-case behind this addition is to allow HTML5 history support for proxied paths. E.g.: proxy: {     '/thepath*': {         target: 'https://otherserver.example.com',         bypass: function(req) {             if (req.headers.accept.indexOf('html') !== -1) {                 console.log('Skipping proxy for browser request.');                 return '/index.html';             }         },     }, },
Message Abstract: Add option to bypass proxying requests based on a function call
Description Abstract: The primary use-case behind this addition is to allow HTML5 history support for proxied paths. E.g.: proxy: {     '/thepath*': {         target: 'link',         bypass: function(req) {             if (req.headers.accept.indexOf('html') !== -1) {                 console.log('Skipping proxy for browser request.');                 return '/index.html';             }         },     }, },

Message: Remove SSL mutual auth requirement from https option
Description: This removes the whole mutual-authentication aspect of the SSL handshake. For many people, a server requesting an SSL client cert means an OS X keychain pop up to unlock the System keychain -- :fearful: :hocho:
Message Abstract: Remove SSL mutual auth requirement from https option
Description Abstract: This removes the whole mutual-authentication aspect of the SSL handshake. For many people, a server requesting an SSL client cert means an OS X keychain pop up to unlock the System keychain -- :fearful: :hocho:

Description: Don't emit "still-ok" when there are errors
Description Abstract: Don't emit "still-ok" when there are errors

Message: Don't emit "still-ok" when there are errors
Description: Emitting "still-ok" and returning means that no "error" event is emitted , forcing the user to manually refresh the page to see compile errors. This change causes compile errors to be shown with no manual refresh needed.
Message Abstract: Don't emit "still-ok" when there are errors
Description Abstract: Emitting "still-ok" and returning means that no "error" event is emitted , forcing the user to manually refresh the page to see compile errors. This change causes compile errors to be shown with no manual refresh needed.

Message: Set Content-Type for live.bundle.js and webpack-dev-server.js
Description: Browsers try to auto-detect files without a Content-Type, and warn in many cases. Google Chrome for example detects the files as text/plain, and then warns when they are used as scripts: 'Resource interpreted as Script but transferred with MIME type text/plain: "http://localhost:8080/webpack_dev_server/live.bundle.js".'
Message Abstract: Set Content-Type for live.bundle.js and webpack-dev-server.js
Description Abstract: Browsers try to auto-detect files without a Content-Type, and warn in many cases. Google Chrome for example detects the files as text/plain, and then warns when they are used as scripts: 'Resource interpreted as Script but transferred with MIME type text/plain: "link".'
